Genomic Foundation Models — Book Outline
Author: Josh Meehl
Format: Quarto book
Date: 12/1/2025

Part I: Foundations of Genomic Data and Pre-DL Interpretation
Ch01: NGS and High-Fidelity Variant Calling

NGS error processes, GATK limitations
DeepVariant: CNN on pileup images, cross-technology generalization
Key refs: @poplin_deepvariant_2018, @lin_deepvariant_2022

Ch02: Polygenic Risk Scores and GWAS Foundations

GWAS design, effect sizes, summary statistics
Linkage disequilibrium, fine-mapping (SuSiE, credible sets)
Traditional PRS (C+T, LDpred), linear assumptions
Heritability partitioning (LDSR)
Limitations: ancestry bias, missing heritability, mechanistic opacity
Key refs: @wu_genome-wide_2024, @rakowski_mifm_2025, @georgantas_delphi_2024, @zhou_sei_2022

Ch03: Establishing Genome-Wide Deleteriousness Scores (CADD)

Proxy-neutral vs proxy-deleterious training
Integration of diverse annotations
CADD v1.7: PLM scores, CNN predictions
Key refs: @rentzsch_cadd_2019

Ch04: Foundational Functional Genomics Data

ENCODE, Roadmap Epigenomics
Histone marks, TFBSs, DNase-seq
Training targets for supervised seq2func models


Part II: Pioneering Sequence-to-Function Deep Learning (CNN Era)
Ch05: DeepSEA and Ab Initio Regulatory Prediction

First deep CNN for noncoding variant effects
919 chromatin profile prediction
Learning regulatory "syntax" from sequence
Key refs: @zhou_deepsea_2015

Ch06: Predicting Transcriptional Effects (ExPecto)

Modular framework: epigenomic CNN → spatial transformation → tissue-specific expression
2,002 profiles, 40kb context
Ab initio disease variant prioritization
Key refs: @zhou_expecto_2018

Ch07: Specialized Prediction – Splicing (SpliceAI)

Ultra-deep residual CNN, 10kb context
Cryptic splice prediction
9-11% of pathogenic mutations are splice-altering
Key refs: @jaganathan_spliceai_2019


Part III: Language Models Enter Biology
Ch08: Sequence Representation and Tokenization

One-hot vs learned embeddings
k-mer (DNABERT), BPE, codon-aware (Life-Code)
Single-nucleotide (HyenaDNA) vs compression trade-offs
Context length evolution: 512 → 100kb → 1M bp
Key refs: @ji_dnabert_2021, @liu_life-code_2025, @medvedev_biotoken_2025

Ch09: Protein Language Models — The First Biological LMs

Evolutionary sequences as natural language
ESM/ESM-2, ProtTrans, ESM-1v (variant effects)
ESMFold (structure prediction)
Transfer to genomics: CADD v1.7, AlphaMissense
Key refs: @rives_esm_2021, @lin_esmfold_2023, @cheng_alphamissense_2023

Ch10: Genomic Language Models and Self-Supervised Pretraining

DNABERT, Nucleotide Transformer, GENA-LM
Species-aware models (GPN, SpeciesLM)
Pretraining objectives: MLM, next-token, span corruption
Key refs: @dalla-torre_nucleotide_2023, @fishman_gena-lm_2025, @benegas_gpn_2024, @karollus_species-aware_2024

Ch11: Hybrid Architectures for Long-Range Expression Prediction

Enformer: CNN + attention, 100kb context, eQTL validation
Borzoi: RNA-seq coverage, multi-layer VEP (transcription, splicing, polyadenylation)
Key refs: @avsec_enformer_2021, @linder_borzoi_2025


Part IV: Modern Frontiers and Practical Considerations
Ch12: Scaling Sequence Context Beyond Attention

Quadratic bottleneck of attention (O(L²))
SSMs, Hyena, quasi-linear scaling
HyenaDNA: decoder-only, 1M bp context
Caduceus/MambaDNA: bidirectional, RC-equivariant
Key refs: @nguyen_hyenadna_2023, @schiff_caduceus_2024

Ch13: State-of-the-Art Variant Effect Prediction

AlphaMissense: PLM + structure, proteome-wide missense
GPN-MSA: MSA + transformer, genome-wide VEP
Evo2: genome-scale LM, zero-shot across variant types
AlphaGenome: unified multi-track, 1Mb context
Key refs: @cheng_alphamissense_2023, @benegas_gpn-msa_2024, @avsec_alphagenome_2025

Ch14: Confounders in Genomic Model Training and Evaluation

Ancestry stratification and population bias
Benchmark leakage (train/test overlap)
Technical artifacts: batch effects, platform differences
Label noise (ClinVar uncertainty)
Cross-ancestry PRS transferability
Key refs: @rakowski_mifm_2025, @vishniakov_genomic_2024

Ch15: Interpretability and Mechanistic Insights

Conv filter visualization, motif extraction
Attribution: ISM, DeepLIFT, integrated gradients
Attention patterns: gLM operons, Enformer distal elements
Sei sequence classes as regulatory vocabulary
TF-MoDISco for de novo motif discovery
Key refs: @zhou_sei_2022, @hwang_glm_2024

Ch16: Integrating Multi-omics and Systems Context

CpGPT (DNA methylation FM)
GLUE (multi-omics integration)
GNNs: MoGCN, CGMega (cancer subtyping)
Rare variants: DeepRVAT
Epistasis: NeEDL, G2PT
DL-enhanced PRS: Delphi, MIFM
Key refs: @cao_glue_2022, @lee_g2pt_2025, @georgantas_delphi_2024


Key Themes Across Book

Data → Architecture evolution: Hand-crafted features → CNNs → Transformers → SSMs
Context length scaling: 1kb → 100kb → 1Mb
Self-supervision: Leveraging unlabeled genomic data
Transfer learning: Protein LMs → DNA LMs; human → cross-species
Clinical translation: VEP, PRS, rare disease diagnosis
Interpretability: From black box to mechanistic insight
